intro: Hieracium solilapidis, commonly known as the sun-lying hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sunny, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces yellow to orange ray florets surrounded by a dense cluster of tubular disk florets. Hieracium solilapidis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
